author: David Carrizales
title: Nuevo León recortará horario en escuelas de educación básica por altas temperaturas | El Universal
text: Más Información Monterrey, 9 de mayo.- A raíz de que ayer se registraron temperaturas máximas de 42 grados centígrados y este jueves hasta 44 grados, la Secretaría de Educación del Gobierno de Nuevo León informó que a fin de cuidar la salud de los alumnos se realizarán ajustes en los horarios de las escuelas de educación básica, cuando las temperaturas excedan los 40 grados centígrados. Además, la dependencia estatal señaló que se reforzarán las acciones de mantenimiento menor para mitigar el efecto de las elevadas temperaturas entre los alumnos y el personal docente. Como parte de estas medidas, cuando la temperatura exceda de los 40 grados centígrados, se reducirá la jornada escolar del turno matutino, para dar la salida a las 11:00 horas, mientras en el turno vespertino las escuelas de Preescolar y Primaria baja (de primero a tercer grado) no asistirán a clases y recibirán apoyo escolar a distancia. Lee también Por temperaturas de casi 50 grados, suspenden clases presenciales en Tec Valles de SLP La Secretaría de Educación exhortó a los padres de familia con hijas e hijos con alguna pre condición de salud, resguardarlos en sus hogares y no exponerlos ante las condiciones climatológicas extremas. Finalmente exhortó a la comunidad educativa a seguir las recomendaciones que realicen Protección Civil y la Secretaría de Salud. En tanto personal de Protección Civil del Estado, inició a partir de las 13 horas el Operativo Hidratación, afuera del Hospital General de Zona número 21 del IMSS que se localiza en entre las avenidas de Pino Suárez y Cuauhtémoc, a la altura de Juan Ignacio Ramón, en el centro de la ciudad. Los brigadistas distribuyeron botellas con agua entre los transeúntes. El miércoles distribuyeron maś de cinco mil litros del vital líquido en Juárez y 5 de Mayo en la plaza de Colegio Civil , en el exterior del Hospital General de Zona número 21 del IMSS, en el Hospital Universitario, Hospital Materno Infantil, que se localiza en Ciudad Guadalupe, en la Clínica 6 del IMSS en San Nicolás de los Garza, y en el cruce Padre Mier y Morelos en el centro de Monterrey, así como en unidades itinerantes. Albergues para migrantes se han vuelto "un infierno" por las altas temperaturas que se viven en Tamaulipas afcl/cr

author: @ChristianPost
title: Franklin Graham Slams Christianity Today Over "Asian Jesus," UN Urges Biden to Nix Title IX, Hobby Lobby's Christmas Tradition
text: Franklin Graham Slams Christianity Today Over "Asian Jesus," UN Urges Biden To Nix Title IX, Hobby Lobby's Christmas Tradition [Subscribe here for Season 3 of Generation Indoctrination](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/generation-indoctrination-inside-the-transgender-battle/id1648997407) Top headlines for Friday, December 29, 2023 In this episode, we address contentious feedback from Evangelist Franklin Graham, who took issue with the claim by Christianity Today that Jesus Christ was Asian, a claim made in an article of the magazine founded by his father. Next, we explore the recent scrutiny of London's Tavistock gender clinic where over a decade, a reported 70 children as young as 3 and 4 were referred for 'gender-affirming' interventions. Lastly, we touch on the chain retailer Hobby Lobby's annual tradition of distributing a Christmas message in newspapers across the United States - a practice nearly 30 years in the making. author: @radioradicale
title: Sciopero Trasporti: il Tar respinge le richieste dei sindacati, intervista al senatore Tino Magni
text:
L'intervista è stata registrata giovedì 28 novembre 2024 alle ore 17:00.
La registrazione video ha una durata di 1 minuto.
Questa intervista è disponibile anche nella sola versione audio.
Rubrica

14:00 - Roma
15:00 - Roma
18:30 - Roma
9:30 - Milano
10:00 - Bologna
senatore (AVS)
Radio radicale siamo col senatore Tino Magni di AVS per parlare del
Del TAR che ha respinto la richiesta dei sindacati di ricorrere contro la precettazione per lo sciopero di domani allora a che punto siamo arrivati punto interrogativo adesso che succede
Ma anche succedere lo sciopero si deve fare ugualmente perché non c'è un diritto individuale del lavoratore quindi come ho detto anche la dichiarazione di voto Duilio Loi domani ovviamente saremo in piazza a sostegno
Ci può portare non solo solidarietà partecipazione oltre che si fanno e invitiamo tutti a scioperare perché è un proprio diritto e quindi non si fa nessuna
Blocco attraverso no imposizione forti voluta da un ministro che anziché locali ciò avrebbe risolvere i prove delle infrastrutture come ha trovato l'audizione del del garante nazionale dei ciò perché oggi Parlamento
è andato alla Camera
Non c'è non non c'ero però il garante deve garantire c'è soltanto il diritto costituzionale questo accordo che versava punto
Chi aspettava questa escalation questo scontro no questi ascari sia l'aspettavo perché ovviamente storiche che un ministro faccia e dica le cose che ha detto inizio Salvini è ovvio che anziché affrontare i suoi problemi contino mettere macigni sul sulla strada e quindi si assumerà la responsabilità tra tra il senatore Tino Magni

author: archyde
title: Mariah Carey: Tough till the end- Knew her sister was dying but never called her
text:
Alison’s close friend David Baker claimed to US Sun that the ‘Don’t Forget About Us’ singer ‘never tried to contact’ her older sister during their estrangement – not even to check on her Alison when she was put into hospice care weeks ago.
“A phone call or, even better, a video call would mean so much to Alison. But it never came,” Baker said in the report on Tuesday.
According to Baker, the older sister was “upset” that Mariah “cut off contact with her” and chose to keep her distance.
“The harsh rejection hurt Alison’s pain more,” he said.
“He talked about it often. He wondered if Mariah or any of her relatives would come to her funeral,” he added. “I was told a memorial service is planned for a future date, but nothing now.”
Representatives for the singer did not immediately respond to her request Page Six for comment.
On Monday, Mariah confirmed the deaths of her sister and mother, Patricia Carey, who tragically died on the same day over the weekend.
“I lost my mother last weekend. Unfortunately, in a tragic turn of events, my sister passed away that same day,” the 55-year-old “Emotions” creator said in a statement to People.
“I feel blessed that I was able to spend the last week with my mom before she passed away. I appreciate everyone’s love, support and respect for my privacy during this difficult time.”
#Mariah #Carey #Tough #Knew #sister #dying #called

author: Michael Carpenter
title: Lowest Food Health Scores for Wilson Co. Feb. 20, 2025 - NewsBreak
text: These are the 5 lowest food health scores for February 10-20, 2025, in Wilson County with their most recent inspection scores. Not all scores are bad, these are just the lowest health scores. Read more local health inspections here! Here are the scores, according to the health department’s latest available information. Department of Health environmental specialists inspect every establishment where food and beverages are prepared and served at least twice a year. Food service establishments are required to post their most recent inspection report in a prominent location where it can be seen by the public, and inspection reports are available for review at Tennessee’s county health department locations. Should a food safety concern be observed during a visit to a food service establishment in Tennessee, please contact Restaurant Complaint/Foodborne Illness Hotline 800-293-8228. The post Lowest Food Health Scores for Wilson Co. Feb. 20, 2025 appeared first on Wilson County Source .

organizations.name: Lowest Food Health Scores for Wilson Co

author: ANI
title: Ajay Singh Urges Fair Chance for Boxers in National Championships | NewKerala.com
text:
Key Points
BFI champions athletes' right to compete in national championships
Administrators must facilitate boxer participation
National event runs March 21-27 in Greater Noida
Singh pledges support for state teams
Speaking about the responsibility of sports administrators, Singh emphasized that athletes work tirelessly to represent their states at the national level and their countries on the international stage. He stressed that participation in such events is a lifelong ambition for many boxers, and it is the duty of administrators to facilitate their journey.
"The utmost responsibility of the Sports Administrators is to ensure that they give their players every opportunity to compete in important events, especially events like the National Championships of a sport. Boxers work very hard to participate in nationals on behalf of their states and then participate in international championships on behalf of their countries. It is their life's ambition to represent their state and their country in the state that they have chosen. So, as administrators, it is our responsibility to ensure that we facilitate this and that they have every opportunity. Whatever politics might be happening, whatever differences there might be in a Federation, boxers must never be deprived of the opportunity of a national competition," Singh told ANI.
He specifically appealed to BFI Secretary General Hemanta Kalita and other state unit administrators to ensure smooth participation for their athletes.
"It is my appeal, to Mr Kalita and to all Administrators of all state units that they must facilitate and they must enable their boxers to participate in the national championship. I have also said that wherever there is a problem...we will all provide all assistance - tickets and accommodation. We will ensure that they are not deprived of this opportunity. So, we welcome them all, and we urge all state administrators to ensure that their teams arrive in time to participate in boxing nationals in Greater Noida between the 21st and 27th of March," he said.
He made it clear that the BFI is committed to ensuring all boxers get a fair chance to compete at the upcoming nationals.
The National Boxing Championships, a crucial event for aspiring and established boxers, will be held in Greater Noida from March 21 to 27.
